title: European shares surge to fresh record highs as luxury giants rally on China stimulus
content: European markets rose to a fresh record high Friday, tracking gains in China on news of a stimulus blitz, while investors also assessed fresh inflation data.
summary: European markets rose to a fresh record high Friday, tracking gains in China on news of a stimulus blitz, while investors also assessed fresh inflation data.

title: Alibaba, Tencent rally as Beijing stimulus plans push China's tech stocks to 13-month high
content: Chinese tech stocks including majors like Alibaba and Tencent rallied this week, pushing them to highs not seen in more than a year.
summary: Chinese tech stocks including majors like Alibaba and Tencent rallied this week, pushing them to highs not seen in more than a year.

title: Shigeru Ishiba is set to become Japan's next prime minister after winning ruling party leadership election
content: Ishiba defeated economic security minister Sanae Takaichi in a runoff, after the two won the most votes in the first round in a crowded field of nine candidates.
summary: Ishiba defeated economic security minister Sanae Takaichi in a runoff, after the two won the most votes in the first round in a crowded field of nine candidates.

title: French inflation cools more than expected in September as energy prices, transport costs decline
content: France's harmonized inflation rate fell sharply in September, preliminary data from the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies showed Friday.
summary: France's harmonized inflation rate fell sharply in September, preliminary data from the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies showed Friday.

title: Commerzbank and UniCredit set to meet as takeover prospect looms
content: Commerzbank and UniCredit are set to begin talks Friday, with the German bank on the defensive over a potential takeover.
summary: Commerzbank and UniCredit are set to begin talks Friday, with the German bank on the defensive over a potential takeover.

title: China's ambitions for semiconductor self-sufficiency thwarted by lack of chipmaking tools
content: Building more advanced lithography machines is a focal point in China's push to develop its domestic semiconductor industry with $96.3 billion in subsidies and preferential policies.
summary: Building more advanced lithography machines is a focal point in China's push to develop its domestic semiconductor industry with $96.3 billion in subsidies and preferential policies.

title: Not just China, Trump 2.0 could spell trouble for U.S. allies as he doubles down on tariff talk
content: Trump's latest presidential campaign has increasingly framed American allies in Europe and Asia as trade rivals and targets for tariffs alongside China.
summary: Trump's latest presidential campaign has increasingly framed American allies in Europe and Asia as trade rivals and targets for tariffs alongside China.

title: India wants to become a semiconductor powerhouse, but it can't do it on its own
content: India has big ambitions to become a semiconductor powerhouse as the world's fifth-largest economy pushes for self-reliance in manufacturing.
summary: India has big ambitions to become a semiconductor powerhouse as the world's fifth-largest economy pushes for self-reliance in manufacturing.

title: China's industrial profits plunge by 17.8% in August from a year ago
content: China's industrial profits plunged by the most in more than a year, National Bureau of Statistics data showed Friday.
summary: China's industrial profits plunged by the most in more than a year, National Bureau of Statistics data showed Friday.

title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Can India grow as fast as China did?
content: The big banks of Wall Street have been quick to tweak what they expect from Indian growth this year.
summary: The big banks of Wall Street have been quick to tweak what they expect from Indian growth this year.

title: The Fed slashed interest rates last week, but Treasury yields are rising. What's going on?
content: Despite a 50 basis point rate reduction, Treasury yields have been moving higher, particularly at the long end of the curve.
summary: Despite a 50 basis point rate reduction, Treasury yields have been moving higher, particularly at the long end of the curve.

title: CNBC Daily Open: More all-time highs? Yes please
content: The S&P 500 has touched new levels on more than 20% of trading days so far this year, noted financial firm Oppenheimer.
summary: The S&P 500 has touched new levels on more than 20% of trading days so far this year, noted financial firm Oppenheimer.

title: Hong Kong's New World Development shares surge 23% after CEO resigns
content: The company said Chief Operating Officer Eric Ma Siu-Cheung has been appointed as the new CEO.

title: China's Xi and top leaders call for halting real estate decline, responding to public concerns
content: While the meeting readout did not provide many details, it is significant for a country where policy directives are determined at the very top.

title: Sam Altman tells OpenAI staff there's no plan for him to receive a 'giant equity stake' in company
content: At an all-hands meeting Thursday, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman denied reports that he received a "giant equity stake" in the company.

title: 'Coolcations' had another big summer. Here are the places travelers went
content: Destinations like Lapland, Finland, and Breckenridge, Colorado, are seeing a rise in seasonal travelers, as visitors seek cooler temperatures in the summer.
summary: Destinations like Lapland, Finland, and Breckenridge, Colorado, are seeing a rise in seasonal travelers, as visitors seek cooler temperatures in the summer.

title: Misinformation running rampant on Facebook has officials concerned about election disruptions
content: After Meta’s layoffs and deprioritizing of news and political content, local election officials say they’re in a precarious spot heading into the elections.

title: Bank of Japan board members split over monetary policy path, meeting minutes show
content: The BOJ raised its benchmark policy rate to "around 0.25%" in a 7-2 split decision in July, marking its highest interest rate since 2008.
summary: The BOJ raised its benchmark policy rate to "around 0.25%" in a 7-2 split decision in July, marking its highest interest rate since 2008.

title: Podcast: How pro video gaming, or esports, is taking off with big dollars behind it
content: In August, the first ever Esports World Cup concluded. It featured more than 1,500 players and a prize pool of $60 million.
summary: In August, the first ever Esports World Cup concluded. It featured more than 1,500 players and a prize pool of $60 million.

title: Eric Adams federal probe hones in on little-known Turkish businessman

title: Google venture arm backs startup aiming to bring mixed reality to any car windshield or plane cockpit

title: Grubhub-owner Just Eat Takeaway to deliver sex toys in partnership with adult retailer Lovehoney

title: Hoda Kotb announces she is leaving NBC's 'TODAY' show
